185993564.review:
I don't understand why this game is praised. The platforming the and tools you have are so shallow, and the hats are "see corresponding glowy thing and press x", except one of them is literally just the run button.
The stealth segments had me almost put the game down right there. This game already has pace issues due to being warped back to the hub after every hourglass, and the cutscenes and dialogue. Mandatory stealth slows the game to an absolute crawl. When mario 64 did it it was fast and you could hop right back in, also theres a reason mario odyssey removed that mechanic all together because its outdated.
Speaking of mario 64, that game had a great camera. This game, had arguably one of the worst cameras i had ever dealt with in a 3d platformer. It's borderline functional outside in open spaces but going into like a walljump area or indoors it breaks completely, and takes away your control of it all the time.
This game has conveyance issues. It doesn't hold your hand which is great, but things like the faucets in mafia town that have a circular arrow path around them. So i assumed i had to run in a circle on it to turn the handle. No. you have to hit it 3 times. Stuff like that is constant.
All the characters and NPC's except the snatcher are completely forgettable. Why would you give them a voice but not give them a personality or dialogue thats worth my time when i wanna hit buttons.
As a 3D platform lover I finally got to this game after 8 years of knowing about it and forgetting about it, and now I kinda wish I hadn't. The people who compare told me this game was on par with mario 64 or banjo kazooie are straight up delusional.

185982901.review:
This is one of those games that took me a while to get around to, but I'm so happy I did. What an absolute joy to play from beginning to end. It's got such fun movement tech and it's really easy to get the hang of. The creativity on display is also top notch!

It did not make the best first impression on me. You need to set up a custom controller for some reason, and if you'd like the taunt to be on the down key instead of the up one, you simultaneously mess up your entire menuing. I also struggled with hats registering when using the quick select window that lead to one or two frustrating moments, but that aside, this game is so, so, so wonderful! I highly recommend you check it out if it looks like it's up your alley.

185747070.review:
a hat in time é uma bela representação de um mundo criado na mão de uma criança, me parece que os desenvolvedores chamaram seus filhos e perguntaram "qual o mundo perfeito para vocês?" E desenvolveram um game baseado em suas respostas... piscinas em lugares inusitados onde se conecta com um tobogã que te joga diretamente para o mar, quarto da protagonista (hat kid) com uma piscina de travesseiros enorme, com um trampolim para se jogar e nadar apenas porque sim, além de muitas ideias criativas, que por mas estranho que pode se parecer, ainda continua de maneira coesa em seu universo, apoiado ao game design, faz o jogador ficar intrigado por detalhes e eventualmente motivado a explorar, ponto exencial do game do seu estilo, um collectathon.

Válido se ressaltar o carinho da empresa para jogos do Nintendo 64 e do seu sucessor, o gamecube, vários elementos dos encontrados é claramente uma inspirados em games como "super Mario 64" e "super Mario sunshine" que ao contrário de ASTROBOT, (jogo mais famoso desse estilo atualmente), não chega a ser uma cópia exata de seus elementos, e sim uma adaptação com claros toques de originalidade, misturados.

Como qualquer jogo existe sim seus defeitos, a câmera sendo uma delas, as vezes podendo ser sua maior inimiga em cenarios mais apertados, mas não chega a ser um agravante tão grande na hora da sua gameplay;
O maior problema que eu vejo é sua curva de dificuldade, sendo que no game inteiro beira a casualidade, podendo um jogador rasuavel finalizá-lo sem muitas preocupações, mas após isso é liberado um elemento extra, sendo eles desafios, que para um jogador mediano é basicamente uma porta aberta para insanidade, mas que de qualquer forma é mto divertido jogar.

Minhas considerações finais, é, jogue esse jogo, um deslumbrante de carinho e atenção dado a um projeto indie, claro que tem suas limitações, justamente por ser uma empresa menor, mas se destaca em momentos icônicos, como a fase do trem e a floresta subcon e personagem carismáticos como a própria hat kid, o snatcher, mustache girls a rainha Vanessa entre outros, dito isso JOGÃO.

185727608.review: Horas e horas de diversão com minha filha, ao longo de alguns anos. Foi o primeiro jogo que ela zerou com 6 anos de idade e até hoje, com 10, ela ainda joga ele. Sobre o jogo em si, pra mim, é uma obra de arte, tanto visual, quanto de originalidade da história, que envolve viagem no tempo, salvação do mundo, conspiração, intrigas etc. São diversos cenários (chuva, vulcânico, neve, na água, andando em corda bamba, invadindo cenário de gravação de filme etc, etc, etc.). Difícil achar um jogo coop local em 3D que chegue perto. Uma pena não haver previsão de um A Hat in Time 2.

185610426.review:
This is my first review on Steam ever so I apologize if it's not of satisfaction but I would just like to tell a small story about how much this game means to me.

I've always had a hard time putting me in new situations(autism) and that includes games. I currently have over 1000 games in my library spead across multiple platforms, most of them unplayed thinking that someday I will play it and right now A hat in time is the game that made me want to break out of my shell and really try to play a game on my own accord.

It's funny, lighthearted, easy to understand, very cartoonish, the hats are pretty cool and that's what I love about this game. There's no pressure at all to do anything. I spent the first hour just jumping around on the first level just discovering everything and feeling the game out. The pressure of fighting and preforming is gone in this title and that made for a very relaxing experience that I probably could never get from any other title that I can think of. It's all puzzle solving and platforming which for me was a good thing. 

It's about as casual as you can get from a game in this genre and I love it with my whole heart. If you're just like me, stuck in a hole exhausted from other games or just life in general, give this game a try.

A Hat in Time made my life better and it has given me the courage to try other games that might be more challenging.
Thank you.

185071253.review:
I love this game.

Back when this dropped alongside Odyssey, Twitter was abuzz with how good this game was, how it was maybe even better than Odyssey!

Is it? Well, Odyssey doesn't have a Trans Flag or Peace and Tranquility, so..

Jokes aside I'm overjoyed I was finally able to experience this game, it's truly phenomenal and I really understand why AHIT got all the hubbub it did back in its heyday.

One issue I have is that I won't be able to replay the game if I ever wanted to, I have Photosensitive Epilepsy and Snatcher's Fight & Mustache Girl's Fight have a chance of giving me seizures given their arenas and attacks, I had to get other people to do them for me.

184904641.review:
[h1] QUE JOGÃO, qual que é o nome da protagonista mesmo? [/h1]

[h2] Gameplay [/h2]

A Hat in Time tem uma gameplay extremamente divertida, os controles respondem muito bem, os power-ups do jogo são muto divertidos, os puzzles são muito envolventes e as fases mesmo, são absurdas.
Do começo do jogo, até o final do Nyakuza Metro, eu não parei de ser apresentado a fases bonitas, um excelente level-design e uma história muito engraçada.

[h2] História [/h2]

A história do jogo é bem bobinha, mas ela é muito engraçada, tem tanto personagem icônico nesse jogo, que é difícil saber de quem eu gosto mais, seja o Condutor sendo um cabeça-quente, o Snatcher (Fantasma da Floresta Subcon) com o jeito arrogante dele, até as focas da DLC do cruseiro foram personagens marcantesKKKKK.
Que nem eu disse, a história é muito legal e eu não consigo ver pontos negativos nela, além de talvez.. ela ser muito bobinha??, mas verdadeiramente tanto faz, o jogo claramente não se leva a sério e essa é a melhor parte sinceramente.

[h2] Soundtrack [/h2]

A Hat in Time.. tem simplesmente.. uma das melhores soundtracks que eu já ouvi num jogo, eu queria poder pegar na sua mãozinha enquanto você lê essa review e te dizer que quando você terminar esse jogo, você [b] VAI [/b]sentir saudade da músicaKKKK, deliciosa é a melhor palavra pra descrever a sensação de ouvir a trilha sonora do game.

[h2] Visual [/h2]

Não deixa o visual mais cartunesco do jogo te enganar, porque ele é lindo, as fases são super distintas uma das outras e isso só mostra o tamanho do carinho pelo level-design e pelo próprio design visual do jogo, cada fase tem seu aspecto único, sua atmosfera única, sua trilha marcante, seus personagens icônicos e tudo isso unido é o que faz o visual desse jogo algo único dele, você não vai ver algo semelhante com A Hat in Time por aí, eu garanto.

[h2] Considerações Finais [/h2]

A Hat in Time pra mim foi um sonho realizado, eu adoro jogos nesse estilo, e esse jogo foi tudo que eu queria, divertido do começo ao fim, é claro que tiveram partes tipo as montanhas, que foram um pouco menos divertidas, mas isso aí é muito parte da minha opinião própria sobre o jogo, e ela não necessariamente representa a qualidade e o aproveitamento que você vai ter jogando, no fim das contas, eu acho que todo mundo deveria ter a chance de jogar esse jogo pelo menos uma vez na vida.

Por fim, A Hat in Time é nota 10/10 ✮⋆˙
+ GAMEPLAY IMPECÁVEL
+ MECÂNICAS DIVERTIDAS
+ VISUAL LINDO
+ HISTÓRIA ENGRAÇADA
+ TRILHA SONORA PERFEITA
+ LEVEL-DESIGN MARAVILHOSO
+ LEGENDADO EM PT-BR
+ MODS DE FÁCIL ACESSO
+ DLC'S DIVERTIDAS
- Preço Caro

184870559.review:
Si Mario 64 y Undertale tuvieran un hijo: El juego

Ya hablando enserio, este juego es muy bueno, aunque debo decir un par de cosas sobre el (ALERTA DE POSIBLE SPOILER).

Lo principal: Los niveles son muy entretenidos, están bien diseñados, muy coloridos y lleno de detalles únicos. Sin embargo algunos niveles son algo cortos, con esto no me refiero que te los puedes pasar en segundos, sino que, en comparación con otros niveles principales te los puedes pasar en 5 minutos que otros niveles.

La música es bastante buena, ninguna queja y es de las mejores cosas del juego.

La historia a pesar de ser una sencilla cuenta con personajes bastante carismáticos, aunque no profundizan mucho en ellos porque recalco, la historia es sencilla debido a que no es el verdadero objetivo del juego, ya que el objetivo es la jugabilidad.

Y hablando de esta última, es lo mejor de este juego, las mecánicas de la protagonista son muy cómodas y fáciles de aprender. Además de ser muy fluida.

Lo secundario: Los niveles de grieta temporal son muy buenos para ser niveles bonus, (además de hacer referencia a los niveles sin el A.Q.U.A.C. de Super Mario Sunshine).

El juego tiene una duración mucho más corta de lo que esperaba, en 8 horas jugando de forma casual sin completar el 100% ya pude desbloquear el nivel final y completar la historia (Aunque hablaré de algo que contrarresta más o menos este punto más adelante).

¿Recuerdan cuando hablé de que el juego no profundiza mucho con sus personajes? Pues bueno, al final quieren que sientas como si ya pasaste toda la vida con ellos y te hacen sentir un poco de tristeza al final,
admito que si sentí algo cuando eso ocurre. Pero como al final no estas con dichos personajes luego de haberte pasado un mundo pues... tampoco es la gran cosa (Sé que soné re hater con este punto pero no me malentiendan, me gustaron mucho estos personajes, es solo que me hubiera gustado que profundizaran más con ellos. Tampoco pido que sea algo igual a Undertale, solo un poco más de profundidad en ellos).

En conclusión, A Hat In Time es un más que excelente juego plataformero, corto pero entretenido, aunque si se te hizo MUY corto entonces cómprate los DLC que añaden mundos extra al juego, aunque por lo que vi en las reseñas de dichos contenidos, parece que no son tan buenos, no puedo opinar mucho porque no he comprado los DLC de este juego, aunque si te los vas a comprar recomiendo que lo hagas cuando estén en oferta.
Si no te interesan los DLC entonces prueba los niveles de la workshop de steam, hay bastantes de calidad por lo que vi.
Y si.. recomiendo comprarlo (Aunque admito que lo compré en oferta xd).
Espero que esta reseña te haya sido útil.

184709970.review:
I suggest this for first timers at platforming! The storyline is short, you could finish it maybe at 4-7 hours tops, but it also has a interesting plot it sticks with. Of course, it's not really the best storyline, but they have holiday events-nothing new, only decorations in the main lobby and a few special quests ONLY if you have the DLC. The worlds are fun to play in and it retains elements similar to Super Mario Odyssey. The graphics are fine, with childish animation. The characters are definitely unique in appearance, but their character backgrounds are pretty plain. 
Example :
Protagonist turned to Antagonist.
Weird people (birds) that hate each other but don't fully hate each other.
(If you consider this somewhat deep then I don't mind. To each their own.)

TLDR ; The game is pretty good for first timers or people who just want to chill. There are some crazy mods and sometimes the game can be tough (like on one certain level that scared the life out of me and several others, but oh well) but also pretty easy. So, buy it, and have fun!

184609492.review:
It's been a while already since this game first came out and I just played through the entire game (in terms of collecting all 40 pieces) and have to say that its quite a neat modern throwback to those early platforming collectathons you dont really see anymore. Or at least I haven't played any other in a long while, but decided to get this while it was on sale.

The gameplay was very well paced imo, easy to navigate and reminiscent of the castle hub in m64. There were enough interesting ideas and concepts thrown into this game that made it enjoyable to play through. the platforming in this game felt natural to other games i played back in the day. It has a good control scheme, even though I was using a keyboard. it was still very managable and I think a controller would be perfect for the speedrunner. Revisiting areas with new items had a good flow throughout the game, only things i didnt really use was the slowtime hat and the umbrella blaster. 

I think the biggest bug with me was it seemed to bit too easy? of course not everything was, there were some moments, I guess if you made it too hard then everyone would compare it to something like DS. It still was a pretty relaxing experience just like those collecathon type of games way back, definitely with more variety in this game. One thing I noticed playing is that it was pretty short. It's a platform puzzle based kind of game so it wasnt gonna be a long game in itself I guess. Finished in about 18 hours and I did take my time playing and also checked every nook and cranny, all in all gameplay wise I was satisfied with what the game offers. pretty neat little story, had creativity and charm. I guess that would move this to the next section.

The graphics in this game are pretty great. not groundbreaking obviously, but it compliments the gameplay well. It's a good example on how little can go a long ways to painting the way a game looks. The colors all felt natural to the theme of it all, each chapter to their own as well. While many may think every video game needs to break graphics cards and be realistic, this game displays a colorful artstyle that reminded me of something that would be on the gamecube. colors pop! The cartoon comedic characters are neat and add more charm to the game, very cool that they added that camera badge it was fun to use time to time.

the story obviously doesnt need much explanation, better story than most platform games decades ago I suppose. Again it was creative and is definitely disctintive in the genre of games its in. imagine if there was like a part two? new items with more platforming elements? as someone whos played the game, i wouldnt mind seeing another(if its good though!). wanting to replay it again is soon to be seen, perhaps if i get a controller and speedrun this game at some point in the future. Its one of those come back and visit ever so often. controller motions are definitely speedrun friendly! great game, great time(get it?) I would put it up there on the shelf of what makes platforming games enjoyale and fun. obviously not perfect, but to my standards of rating this one is a high 4.5/5 stars!  

thanks to anyone who read this far, It was one of those days ya feel like typing a review.

EDIT: I totally forgot to mention the music and sound effects in this. all in all, pretty good and connects with the whole theme. whismical, upbeat, goofy. really nice icing on the lava cake!

184462035.review: One of the funnest and most charming 3D platformers I have ever played I seriously didn't want the game to end once I was done but would happily playthrough it again in the future which I would never say for any other platformer seeing how short and simple this one is, this game NEEDS a sequel that is 3x as long.

184449096.review:
Esse jogo é excelente e é um sopro de ar fresco com tantos jogos indie tentando imitar a era 16-bits/32-bits. Captura excepcionalmente a essência dos jogos collect-a-thon da era do 64 até a do Gamecube, e eu diria que esse jogo faz melhor do que a maioria dos jogos daquela época.
Além disso, a história e os personagens são super charmosos e cheios de personalidade. E por mais que geralmente falem sobre esses aspectos do jogo, a gameplay, por mais que básica, não deixa a desejar.
Entretanto, eu tenho duas críticas. A primeira é sobre a câmera, que pode ser bem desengonçada e desconfortável e muitos momentos, e por mais que habilitar as opções de câmera manual alivia bastante os problemas, eu ainda não acho ela muito boa, mas talvez essa seja a intenção já que Super Mario 64 tem provavelmente a pior câmera que eu já experienciei em um jogo de plataforma 3D na minha vida. A segunda crítica não é bem uma crítica mas um problema de habilidade meu, e é sobre o quão intuitivo o design é. Teve algumas vezes que eu me encontro completamente perdido no mapa sem saber qual é o objetivo ou para onde ir, e eu tive até que assistir uma walkthrough para que eu tenha a mínima noção do que eu deveria estar fazendo. Esse problema é bem evidente na fase "O Assassinato no Expresso Coruja".
No geral, eu recomendo demais esse jogo, muito bom. Ainda não zerei, mas pode ter certeza que eu irei.

184159685.review:
A Hat in Time is good.

Like, really good.

Like, really REALLY good.

Screw it, I'm saying it

A Hat in Time is a masterpiece.
There. I said it.

A fun little game about a fun little alien called Hat Kid.

" The spaceship breaks!!!
Aaaaaaah!
And then mafia town.
In mafia town you meet friend called Mustache Girl
[spoiler]Spoiler alert: She's the villan.[/spoiler] "

That's basically how the first act goes.

I like this game.

My 3rd favorite part of this game is the workshop.
I play this game on my Steam Deck and since I have 89 workshop subscriptions the game just crashes when I launch my file but the solution is just don't get mods! I guess.

Finally I have one thing to say.

This game.
is.
fun.

183987861.review:
A light-hearted game that'll have you amused. Personally, I dislike games with confusing controls (mostly platformers like Celeste), but I found this game's controls easy to grasp in it's 3D cartoon-style world(s). If you're also looking for a challenge, Death Wish (a part of the 'Seal the Deal' DLC, a must-grab for fans) will have you on the edge of your seat, its most infamous level being the 1-Heart boss rush.

Do not fret old timers, it bears most resemblance to Super Mario 64, and doesn't disappoint with a similar formula.
A decent 9/10, unfortunate that the DLCs are behind money (despite being mostly worth it).
